propel.core.initialisation

Interface InitGuard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultiInitGuard, SingleInitGuard

    public interface InitGuard
    Interface of class that implement an initialisation guard. Such classes can be used to enforce checks that a class has been initialised one or more times, by throwing exceptions when such conditions are not met.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assertInitialised()
      Call to assert that initialisation has taken place prior to this call
      void assertNotInitialised()
      Call to assert that initialisation has NOT taken place prior to this call
      void initialise()
      Call to set the state to initialised.
      boolean isInitialised()
      Returns true if the state is initialised
      void uninitialise()
      Call to un-initialise this object

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise()
        Call to set the state to initialised. Depending no the implementation this may be a call-once method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the class has already been initialised and multiple initialisations are not allowed

      • uninitialise

        void uninitialise()
        Call to un-initialise this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The class has not been initialised yet

      • assertInitialised

        void assertInitialised()
        Call to assert that initialisation has taken place prior to this call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The class has not been initialised

      • assertNotInitialised

        void assertNotInitialised()
        Call to assert that initialisation has NOT taken place prior to this call
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The class has already been initialised

      • isInitialised

        boolean isInitialised()
        Returns true if the state is initialised
